intro: Loxanthocereus aticensis, commonly known as the Aticínes cactus, is a species native to the arid regions of northern Mexico. It is a columnar cactus with a distinctive reddish-brown color and spiny stems. The plant produces yellow flowers during the spring and summer months, which are pollinated by nocturnal insects. It has a deep root system that allows it to survive in harsh, dry environments. Loxanthocereus aticensis is adapted to thrive in full sun and requires minimal water, making it a hardy plant for desert gardens.
